intro: Leptarrhena micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered leptarrhena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with woody stems and small, elliptical leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
